posts.com:
DAILY REMINDER - GPS absolutely proves globe Earth, rotating Earth, space, orbiting satellites, time dilation (relativity), and gravity.

Flerfers will point to LORAN and claim that GPS could work off of transmitters sitting on the ground, on balloons, or on airplanes. But it cannot.

Why? I'm glad you asked.

In tracking mode GPS receivers use Doppler signal analysis to determine receiver velocity. It is impossible for a transmitter to fake Doppler signal shift across 360°. If the transmitter was lying about its speed, then the receiver would think that it was moving at high mach based on the incorrect Doppler shift in the signal. And since GPS is computed in 3D space from four satellite signals, if the satellites were lying about their positions (altitudes) the resulting location and altitude on the receiver would be off by thousands of miles.

This means that GPS satellites are provably at orbital altitudes and speeds, because GPS could not function at all if the satellites were lying. And if the satellites aren't lying, then space is real. Orbits are real. But the dome is not real. Not unless the satellites punched through it.

What about Earth's shape? GPS receivers use a spherical model of Earth. If Earth was really flat, then receivers would report altitudes literally thousands of miles off. This means Earth really is a sphere.

Furthermore, both Earth's rotation and time dilation must be accounted for in GPS. If either one was not true then, once again, receivers would give obviously false and useless results. That means Earth really is rotating. And time dilation is real. And if both orbits and time dilation are real, that pretty much guarantees that gravity is real.

No single instrument completely shatters all of flat Earth mythology quite like the GPS constellation. It really is a beautiful thing.

inb4
>MUH PHYSICIST MIS-QUOTES!
Because flerfers like to use pilpul to argue endlessly over their misquotes, we'll just cut to the chase and dismiss this as an appeal to authority fallacy.

>MUH ROTATING AETHER!
Michelson-Morley disproved the theory of a luminous aether.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michelson–Morley_experiment

>NOOOOO! THE AETHER IS REALLY THERE!
MM has been repeated with instruments 2 orders of magnitude more sensitive. Still null.

>BUT FRINGES WERE DETECTED! MUH AETHER IS ROTATING!
Fringes are always within the device error range. As devices become more accurate, the fringes become smaller, ultimately by two orders of magnitude. Either the aether is magically slowing its rotation as we build more accurate interferometers...which also means a rotating aether cannot explain RLG results...or there is no aether.

>BUT MUH DEVICE ORIENTATION!
During a MM experiment the device is slowly rotated 360°. The result is a graph, not a single reading. There are no orientation errors due to time.

>BUT MUH AETHER VORTEX MPH VARIES WITH LATITUDE AND ALTITUDE!
But the speed of light does not vary with latitude or altitude, which rules this out entirely.

>BUT MUH ROTATING DOME SHELL INERTIAL FORCES! MUH CORIOLIS FORCE!!!
RLGs do not rely on inertial or Coriolis forces. They rely entirely on Sagnac.

>BUT HAWKING SAID!

>Career
The Four of Wands in the tarot represents celebration, happiness, and completion of a project or goal. In terms of career, this card suggests that you may be reaching a successful milestone or accomplishment in your work. The Wheel of Fortune, on the other hand, indicates that there may be changes or unexpected twists and turns in your career path.

Combined, the Four of Wands and the Wheel of Fortune suggest that you are likely to experience a time of celebration and success in your career, but that you should also be prepared for potential changes or surprises along the way. This could mean that a long-term project or goal finally comes to fruition, or that an unexpected opportunity arises that propels you to new heights in your career.

In terms of action, it is suggested to enjoy the moment and savor your achievements, but also to keep an open mind and be ready to adapt to new developments in your career. It might be a good idea to also to keep your options open and consider new opportunities that may arise.

In short
So, the Four of Wands in the tarot is like a "yay we did it!" card for your career. It means you're hitting a big milestone or accomplishment in your work. But, the Wheel of Fortune is like a "but wait" card. It means things are gonna change or be unpredictable in your career. So, put together, it looks like you're gonna have a moment of celebration and success, but be ready for things to be different or unexpected. Basically, enjoy your win, but also keep your mind open to new opportunities or changes that might come up.

OP, I'll clarify for you but you're asking for spoonfeeding, you're (probably) a full-grown man. In this post i'll adopt the spirit model of reality, not the energetic, mental, or physicalist.

>demonic possession
the term you're looking for is invocation. This can be done with any spirit. Possession is what happens when someone consciously or unconsciously does this to an extreme level. It's not really beneficial to do this. Invocation is when you take on the qualities of the spirit, usually with some ritualistic trappings, and then you go about your day.
>Books to engage with spirits
Gallery of magick is a contemporary group that distills lots of old teachings. You won't go wrong spending a year or two going through their books one by one. Other contemporary authors like corwin hargrove and etc. are okay. Older sources I'm familiar with include the Lemegeton, Hygromanteia (sp), greek and egyptian magical papyri, and the heptarchic, elemental, and zodiacal systems of john dee. Generally these aren't "demon" focused in the christian sense, other than the lemegeton. The 72 demons popularized by crowley operate as part of a larger system involving angels to guide and constrain the energies of the demon, again, GoM has a good rundown.
>Other sites
No clue, just go on /omg/ and go into "western occultism" on the Mega, download and read the grimoires there.
Don't be desperate, don't be an edgelord, don't be pathetic, don't be impatient, and don't be self-deprecatory.
>how to contact
You need to develop your perception. Meditation is a must. Laterally shifting your consciousness without drugs is, too. You can make a sigil of the entity, that's partly why people like the 72, they have sigils. Mantra works well to facilitate contact for me. Ritualistic trappings can help. You can make talismans to invite the energies for a purpose. eg I like to engrave brass discs with the seal of the daemon on one side, w/ seal of shem hamephorash on obverse.

>>33860903
I can't vouch for other people's experiences, I can only share my own. With that in mind:
>how is spirit contact experienced?
depends on the person's aptitudes and inclinations. For me, there's 3 or 4 different "levels."
1. do the magic, everything seems like regular, every day life. No feeling of contact, nothing. Purely imaginative responses.
2. do the magic, there is a shifting of my perceptions. senses are acute and muddled at the same time. This is usually where I am. If you do any neidan or energy work, and get in the zone, this should be familiar. No need for two way comms.
3. do the magic, definite sense of Presence. When I seek evocatory contact, this is where I am. Two way communication is clear, here, for me.
4. acute awareness of Presence, coincident with some sort of visual, emotional, and psychological contact.
Then there's 5, which is full power Behold, an actual physical real life entity in front of you clear as day. I've never seen a humanoid or animal figure. At most it's a visual haze, a rushing in the ears, and so on. That's like 4. I've only ever seen or heard what I would call angels, at specific blessed locations. It's usually more subtle than that, for me.
>how do I differentiate between a voice in my head and spiritual contact?
That's why meditation is so key. Being able to observe and identify your thoughtstream in real time isn't hard. There is a distinguishable difference. Those times when I have had two-way communication, or have received inspired insight, and so on, it's been irrefutable. Example: I sought insight into my life path and what to do. After some work was presented with a vision, and some words. It was a very simple, very clear answer to my problem, which I had never really considered before, but made sense. Other times, it's been an actual conversation. Ask a q, wait for answer, receive none, get in the meditative zone, ask again, remove egoic barriers, etc., the answer comes. Proficiency comes with practice.

>>33862072
Becoming a Hollywood actor these days, probably for decades now, essentially selling your soul to the devil. The mega fame and fortune you want has less to do with your talent and more to do with unscrupulousness and lucking out for the big break.

If you want to become a legitimate actor, you are possibly out of luck. "They" control most of the big outlets for getting yourself out there. Suppose you find an independant film-maker: you have to be talented to catch their eye. Great acting entails making the observer believe you are 100% a real person who is (most often) not yourself---bringing a character to life and being compelling about it.

My advice to you would be to give yourself in real life trials. You should enjoy this, based on your chart. Go and interact with random people who don't know you, and introduce yourself as a made-up person who is dissimilar to who you actually are. Pretend to be somebody else and see how convincing you can be, how well you can stay in character, and how much you can move the other people with your performance.

If you can't do this, you can't act, and you're probably only going to succeed by taking lots of cock.

You see, you've skipped out on taking challenges for so long that you don't even know what you're good at and good for. You can see how you've neglected to introspect much in all this time, prefering to just get on with life. But I tell you, it's left you in this place where you have a high amount of self-confidence, but no real plan or experience to back it up.

My advice would be to just try and take a little bit of time to explore potential skills you could pick up. Your talent is in a sense, getting your own way, but that's often the trade of con-men, you understand.

>>33848290
I'd suggest that everyone who meditates or wants to start meditating to ask himself the question: Why am I meditating/Why I want to meditate?
So yeah, ask yourself that question.

Ask yourself: Why I want to open my chakras or manipulate energy?

I'm suggesting this because people get into meditation to either chase illusions and other ego-stuff (like goals) or to try and escape from illusions (fears, trauma etc), I think that this is wrong and that meditation should be used for the exact opposite: To realize that all of that are illusions and nothing more.

I'd suggest to just sit and be aware of your body sensations, of your body being there and breathing, not analyzing it or controlling it but totally letting it go and just watching it. This is the basis of the meditative state: Being aware.

But don't put words into it, don't make goals, just do it everyday and stay there.
Depending on who you are this may take some time.

And lastly to also answer your question: You "open chakras" by focusing on them, yeah, meditation is a physical practice not a mental one, you sit to sense and feel so just sit and feel the chakras.

However I'd suggest that first you sit to silence the mind by being still and aware.
Good luck.

>>33853135
>>33853173
There is no division between mindfulness and meditation. Mindfulness is a word that was taken from western spiritual traditions to translate the word "Sati", and it was re-adopted by western society for largely marketing purposes. It's a cozy word. Really, meditation (samadhi) is a focused application of mindfulness (sati). There is no meditation without mindfulness; samma samadhi is the result of samma sati. The Satipatthana sutta is the frame within which all other meditation methods occur in. To be mindful is to keep something in mind, and in Buddhism that's within the framework of the four satipatthana.

I haven't been trained in Zen but I have experience serving retreats at Thai Forest monasteries, where I did read some books on Zazen... the gist I got was that we "just sit to sit" or "sitting is good for nothing". While I can't say how accurate my understanding is, I think this is helpful for times when you get too caught up in goals to the point where you're stressing yourself out, in which case it may be wise to just get back to the bare bones: sitting. But doing that for a while, your mind gets a bit listless or confused, in which case it's helpful to remember why you're practicing in the first place. But sometimes to go deep you have to put aside the part of the mind which is constructing goals and reasons for focusing attention. In a way you have to "just do it". Think Solid Snake in Metal Gear Solid: "Don't think, shoot!"

But in any case, there is mindfulness: remembering to "just sit" or remembering the 16 steps of Anapanasati. You need to read your own mind, so to speak, to see what's good for you. posts.com:
>>33848290
One of the best uses of meditation is training focused contemplation. You do this through sitting, eyes closed, breathing, and every time you stop paying attention to your breath, you recognize it and pull your attention back to your breathing. It starts with that. Eventually, feel free to let yourself off the leash a little and mentally wander around during your meditation. Something to be cautious of is accidentally developing a dissociative disorder. Be mindful of when that feeling starts to develop and work through it in a healthy way. If you navigate that properly, you have crossed a really powerful milestone in building your skill. If you don't arrive at that point, you haven't been meditating long enough or seriously enough. It's worth getting into, but don't let it consume you. Meditation for me has been at its most beautiful when it feels spontaneous and unplanned. It's ugly when you treat it like it's something you have to pencil in: "oh it's time for my 5 minute 4:00 PM meditation!" When it's just like "hmmm I feel like this is a good time to meditate" that's when I tend to have my best sessions.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33857923
There's a point in that kind of goal-less practice where you're actually kind of just feeding whatever is going on, if you aren't considering your input in the experience. It's like having the TV turned to static and just letting it sit like that forever. Giving your mind an object to focus on and refine, such as the breath "energy", gets you deeper.

But being aware of those things is crucial - you just need to stop giving them input if they're causing too much movement or darker states of mind. Instead of seeing thoughts just as some things which happen, see how they arise due to things within your control (your volitional thoughts and way of seeing things, posture, etc). Learn to use those things to relax the body while brightening and stilling the mind.

Once you've become absorbed in the body, things are much more clearer and expansive. Sometimes there is a sense of great space (you can focus on that to develop it, too).

It's important to balance effort and relaxation here. Too much effort or striving and you just get uptight and frustrated. Too much relaxation, you fall asleep or get lazy and dull. In a way you need to let the breath do the work... "allow it" to soften, fill the body, etc. Release the blockages and tight spots and let the body feel more still.

I have a feeling that the magical trance is just a way of clearing the mind to be able to better describe the magical associative relationship between the magical operation and the desired outcome.
Magic doesn't make sense if you only take into account physical effects because it is designed to lower the entropy of systems to make outcomes more likely. Entropy is, however, a measure of information, this means that in order for entropy to decrease you must increase the information content somewhere else by at least the same amount. I have reason to believe that the place where this information content is increased is a non-physical place which the mind has some effect on.

By making a magical operation and describing exactly what you would like to happen you are giving back the information you are taken from the physical system to its "metaphysical" counterpart.

In theory, technology such as the computer and television are not technically bad. They are rather, or were intended to be, neutral tools.
But the reality is that they are not neutral tools. The internet was once more good then bad, but we are far past that point.
>What are demons?
In Buddhism it is said that a Demon is not only an external being, but it also refers to your own delusional and unhelpful states of mind (such as addiction). These demons are colloquially referred to as mara's. Which are organized as such.
1.Skandha-māra (representative to clinging of forms, perceptions, and mental states as ‘real’)
2. Kleśa-māra ( representative of addiction to habitual patterns of negative/destructive emotion)
3. Mṛtyu-māra ( representative of both fear of literal death and the fear of impermanence and change)
4. Devaputra-māra (representative of both addiction to pleasure and actual demonic beings.)
>Where does this fit into the internet/computer/television being full of demons?
In Buddhist thought it is said that ones own internal demons are what attract external (ie 'real') demonic beings.
The internet and television both, regardless of their original intent, have been taken over by mentally defiled bureaucrats at different times. When they were taken over, what came out from this was a systemic and continuous attempt to utilize the internet/television to ensure every adult and child was helplessly addicted and distracted. The individual would forever chase at shadows and try to indulge/buy/scroll/watch away their worries forever. They would be obsessed by their own internal demons at any given time.

There's no exact 'purpose'. Thinking there is one winds up encouraging you to think in terms of rigid mental constructs and leads back to the same problem.
However, there is a way life is supposed to be experienced. I won't call it a purpose, but it underscores the reality of it I think.
Life is fluid. In thailand, a holdover from the pre-colonized culture there's a saying; Life is supposed to be sanuk (fun).
It is also the exact opposite to the global western culture, which does not encourage real fun but instead escapism.
The meaning behind life is supposed to be fun isn't an encouragement of chasing sensual pleasure (thus doing things which may be 'fun' for sense desire but harmful to yourself and others), but instead to embrace the fact that life is impermanent and to be compassionate to everyone (including you)!
Embrace life being impermanent, become mindful of the present moment. When you do that, you begin to derive actual fun which is pure from the world around you and not defiled by destructive emotions. It means not working in jobs that hurt you and others, but ones you actually love that bring your mind peace (yes, for some people that is being a janitor). It means that even when you're doing something physically taxing, your mindfulness of that present moment allows you to derive genuine fun from it. Suddenly you don't need to do drugs anymore, or any other addiction and escapism or harmful action. What you have now is enough, you're happy.
Stop doing things that hurt everyone, do things that increase the pure happiness of everyone and yourself.
I've seen what that world could be like, it's amazing.

The internet and television could become methods of sharing things of value instead of demon tools.

During a time of my life involved with heavy meditation, I had several times where I would slip into a state where I was perceiving what this world could be like if the minds of people in it were pure of hatred/greed/delusion.
The most striking of which was this;
>My apartment was no longer the standard white dull prison, instead it was built out of old wood beautifully and only slightly bigger. My apartment wasn't the only thing like this, everything was made beautifully in order to instill peace and joy to the mind.
>There was a semi-large window, and outside of it was beautiful emerald green trees. Buildings in this world were no longer built AGAINST nature but with it instead. And the pollution was non existent to the point that light and clouds formed the way they would have without any of it. A beautiful almost blue-grey sky, it had been raining earlier.
>Because there was no pollution, the air felt intrinsically clean around me. It tasted almost sweet.
>The mindfulness and peace of the world pervaded the air, and imbued the beauty already there with more emphasis. It felt both timeless and slow, warm inside.
>It was sparsely furnished/decorated inside, but was similar in look to a tibetan home prior to the invasion of the chinese. But it was distinctly american, if america perhaps had never valued consumption.
>I had something similar to a CRT on a table by the far wall near the window. By it my colourful chair. In my hands I was carrying a butter tea, and I set it down on the table infront of the TV.
>The TV was playing some sort of show similar to Jim Henson's the story teller. It was beautifully made, the colours of it were vivid and warm. All art in that world was beautiful, and all of it imbued with deep meaning. Even the funnier things meant for simple enjoyment.
>I myself felt peace, and I was ok.
This is a glimpse I had into what our world could be like.

> I have a notebook where I write about my dream home. One of the concepts is aversion to sterile cubic rooms and an integration of wood, clay, or other natural materials in some manner of asymmetrical and organic design. These rooms we live in probably damage us.
Yes, they do. The rooms themselves have been proven on the materialistic level to cause extreme stress and anxiety. This is especially true for city dwellers.
Architecture has two concepts, called 'moving places' and 'staying places'. The idea is exactly what it sounds like, basically there's places designed to live in and places to move through.
Most modern architecture is all designed to be "moving places", insofar as that they're made to be mass sellable as quickly as possible. People need to move in and out of them as quickly as they can so it's back on the market to whoever will pay the highest for it. So it's sterile and boring and is composed of shapes that cause anxiety and distress.
The way you've described your dream home is more or less how architecture for people is supposed to be.

>>33854958
>Is manifesting an SP bad?
It's not necessarily "karmically" bad (but it does depend, like if you break up a relationship to get with someone), but you've seen from your own experience that it doesn't work out. Many anons report the same, that they get short-lived success. That's the main reason why LoA teachers usually advise against it (they're usually fine with healing relationships though).

I actually have no idea where the term SP comes from, because I've never seen it in any written works, so I always assumed it was more of a "fake" LoA, or more faux "law of attraction" term, like what some soccer mom reading The Secret would talk about (not saying that The Secret doesn't work for people though).
>I’ve recently seen a lot of people saying you can’t make anyone love you/ steal their free will.
So, just in general, free will is a loose concept. For example, let's say you manifest money. Well, in most cases, you might not be thinking about a person in particular to give you that money, but when money ends up going to you, it probably came from someone, right? So, just in general, I wouldn't worry about free will, because everyone only has it to a degree (Neville talks about there being a level of "agreement" for any manifestation, Florence talks about how you and others influence and impress each other to some extent).

If you are thinking about it in terms of karma/morality, then the only thing I'd be concerned about is coming up with the decision that you're best suited for that person. Like, manifesting something like health or wealth for someone else will probably always be good for someone, but with love and relationships, that might end up with more selfish outcomes.
>I always just assumed they loved me back naturally
There is that approach, but you could also just go for "implications" of you both being happy. So, imagine you both being in happy relationships, and you'll both be happy whether that ends up with you together or with others.

3 hours of any of the methods is generally the amount of time required to achieve tangible results (just be careful about your health)
Horse Stance (picrel): The practioner stands in such a manner where qi is locked into their dantian and they can recieve an equal amount of terrestrial and heavenly qi. This is more of a subtle method so the effort and return is not as high however it is more simple than some of the more advanced methods.
Qigong/Tai Chi: Exercises to cultivate the inner energy through a series of movements meant to represent the microcosmical phases of nature, there are many different forms of this but all of them involve some form of movement and exercise to cultivate energy.
Qi Meditation: This is a bit more complex however the general idea is that the practioner must build psychic awareness to the point they can visualize their meridian network, once this is accomplished you circulate qi through the meridians and the which raises the level of qi.
When looking for information on these subjects view everything with a skeptic eye.

I've only been practicing qigong for about three weeks now, but I've found a noticeable improvement in my sleep quality, my focus, and my body has begun to feel lighter. I work a pretty physical job and I am often in a lot of pain after work, but since I started doing 3-stage breathing at the subway station while focusing on my chi, the pain fades away before I even get home.

From what I've learned from reading and practice, there are two places where benefits come from. First, the cleansing of your meridians/chakra/space veins or whatever you want to call them seems to provide a noticeable improvement to your body. Probably improves circulation and balances hormones and other gland type stuff, possible as a side effect of the brain being able to put more of it's resources towards your body due to the de-stressing. Second, storing energy in your body feels like it's actually working as advertised, and my energy levels and mental clarity has been much more stable over the day than before. For example, it's no longer difficult to get up and do dishes after getting home from work, because I feel just as energized at home as I do at work.

Read about this shit in a bunch of silly fantasy books, tried it out irl and found that its actually pretty legit. I want to learn some of the kung fu that goes a long with chi work, but I don't think I ever will have the opportunity in a traditional sense. I'm still just happy that this stuff is working well.

If you want to know about chi based fighting, check out snake style kung fu. While there are elements of using your chi as a weapon, snake style is largely about tapping in to chi to enhance your reflexes to a level of near-precognition and achieving a hypersensitive state of mind.

The real Chinese masters are from Taiwan now. This is because they were persecuted by the CCP, and had to flee mainland China. Maybe some of them ended up in Hong Kong, but the best all went to Taiwan.
There are some valuable principles in the internal arts but it is not the woo woo people here think it is. The term "internal" is referring to the internal muscles of the body, rather than the muscles of the limbs. It is a gross misunderstanding of Chinese language and philosophy to interpret these things as supernatural abilities. However, I found the Chinese way of describing and training these principles very helpful. The brief lessons I had with a legit internal arts instructor gave me an understanding of several principles that I applied to my own arts. One thing I noticed right away about Chinese internal arts, is that they are very well thought out training methods designed to give you as much ability as possible without damaging your body. They will never defeat someone like Tyson or a great muay thai fighter, but they won't be brain damaged or crippled by 50 either. They will also absolutely wreck an untrained street punk.
There are no magic secrets, Anons. Fighting takes a LOT of hard work, and to be a champion you will ultimately have to destroy yourself. There is nothing on this planet that will make a 98 pound weakling able to defeat a heavyweight MMA champion, empty handed. Fill your hand with steel, well that's a different story, and where all of that "size does not matter" bullshit comes from.

>>33848043
The thing with Sagittarius is that it's been heavily stereotyped in a way that's divorced from real life Sagittarians. For some reason, it and Jupiter have been deemed entities of great wisdom and mental power, in such a way you'd think they'd be genius sages on average.

In real life, Sagittarius energy is borderline ADD and dilettante-ish if in any way intellectual, just being a flaneur who enjoys new experiences thoroughly and has an insatiable need for good and high vibes. Fire signs aren't necessarily dumb, but they're not intellectuals. Sagittarius intellectualism is simplistic stuff like "Be like water, my friend" (Bruce Lee, Sagittarius). They are more likely to be athletes of some sort than philosophers, because they have a lot of energy to expend and seek out ever more ways to expend and replenish it. It just happens that some of the energy spills out into the mind and makes for curious people who like to figure things out from time to time.

Sagittarius is one of the least analyzed because it's one of the most complicated, but it's partially one of the most complicated in large part because the common conception that's been established is highly fractured and somewhat contradictory.

I find Aquarius to suffer the same fate. That also has been romanticized in such a way that it's become divorced from the whole, actual truth.

calm on the outside, turbulent emotions but nurturing and gentle, good with emotionally stunted people but tend to get walked over by strong egos.

really cool, wants everyone to walk to their beat and if they dont then they get fucked up and depressed. passionate, stylish and no fear of showing it.

Cool calm friendly to their friends, emotionally detached/guarded, trouble falling in love. Loves to gossip but doesnt tell anyone what they shouldnt. Vengeful when crossed.

Sex pests, cool and fun to be around generally. Hot tempers when tested. Loyal friends. Not the brightest bunch.

To show you where the analyses arose from, however (although I won't get into aspects and houses here):
>intelligence
Sun in Capricorn, Mercury in Capricorn in particular, possibly Virgo Ascendant and Saturn in Gemini, possibly Uranus and Neptune in Aquarius, and possibly Venus in Sagittarius.
>low attention span
Pluto in Sagittarius, Venus in Sagittarius in particular, Moon in Aries in particular, Saturn in Gemini
>inertia
Mars in Pisces in particular, Jupiter in Cancer perhaps, Chiron in Capricorn perhaps
>dependable
Sun in Capricorn, Jupiter in Cancer, Virgo Ascendant perhaps, Mars in Pisces may suggest a latent desire of sorts to help others, particularly those in a bad shape and real need
>short temper
Moon in Aries in particular, Saturn in Gemini perhaps, Venus in Sagittarius perhaps, the Capricorn placements can make it hard for you to tolerate others' perceived stupidity, as in problems that they themselves have caused yet appear oblivious to the fact, and Virgo Ascendant can also manifest as a critical nature.

With all that said, you probably experience too a sense of shame through a feeling of hypocrisy, that you have all these things negative to point out about others and yet you're not living up to your own potential.

As for the other guy's criticism that my reading is generic and applicable to anyone, maybe 4chan just infamously attracts a lot of cynical underachievers with high potential to be great. Capricorn is a very solid core for accomplishing things in life and making something of yourself.

Aries Moon has a kind of malefic effect of making you restless and irrational. We live in a social context where you are not allowed to beat down your enemies or express your rage in the heat of the moment, so this means that it's something you must be mindful to control lest it bring you ruin; but you can imagine how not hesitating to slay those you've deemed a threat to you, or feeling the need to constantly be on the move and searching for something (along with Venus in Sagittarius), could be very useful natural traits to have in other contexts, like a state of nature or the wild west. So you shouldn't perceive it as unconditionally negative, just not conducive to your current environment.

On the other hand, you have Mars in Pisces which dampens your willpower and energy and probably redirects it from personal gain to the benefit of whatever "others" you favor.

If you were to combine the influences, you'd naturally make a good shephard of other people, providing protection, stability, guidance, and assistance; but perhaps you have other dreams of being someone others cater to and wait upon.

It does depend upon what you feel is your purpose in life, which is not necessarily intertwined with your talents and aptitudes. posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33845665
>Thank you for the reading. I feel like I have strong ideals, but am eccentric in my work and pursuits as well.
I am not sure if it is possible to read someone's ideals from a zodiac - maybe some could do it, but I can't. One of the people I deeply admire had very strong Taurus placements and he is the most idealistic person I've ever seen, so it's certainly possible - for a lot of other people, "idealism" is just a word or something they think, but with fixed earth signs like Taurus, idealism means inflexibly adhering to your ideal through the greatest storms and arduously working towards its achievement, come what may. It's an idealism married to determination and hard work.
The red lines are called challenging aspects: squares and oppositions. Aspects are links between planets, excluding co-presence and conjunction, which do not have any lines - you have a ton of planets in co-presence, so only your squares from the 2nd to the 5th house light up.
There's a handful of aspect types: outside of conjunction, there's sextile, trine, square and opposition. The last two are difficult, the middle two are beneficial. Sextiles have a range of 3 houses, squares 4, trines 5, oppositions 7. Your 2nd to 5th house is a range of four, so you have squares between your moon and your 5th house planets. A square is a challenge, but it is not necessarily bad - it causes difficulties that result in events, developments, growth etc. It can produce both good and bad results depending on your actions. These moon squares are the only aspects you'd have from a Hellenistic perspective, which is the perspective I use. They're the better 'negative' aspect to have - oppositions are worse because there's no way to "resolve" them and there is no action generated from them, the only way to deal with them is to strike a balance between the opposing planets. Sextiles and trines refer to either minor or major harmony between the planets involved.
tl;dr planet placements determine aspects

You mean the square aspects? You might be onto something, actually. Keep in mind that I am trying to read your chart in Hellenistic whole sign (even though you posted your chart in Placidus). It is interesting though. You don't quite have a grand cross because the degrees don't quite align, but you do have a sign-based grand cross, I guess. It's all mutable signs too, actually - your only non-mutable placement is Venus in Taurus. Honestly, you could probably get a whole professional reading just on this aspect form.
Honestly, I am not sure where to start with interpreting this because I've never done a grand cross (or a grand cross-like formation) before. I guess the most important things you need to know is that a square is a very energetically intensive placement - conflicts always breeds a lot of movement, and it can lead to powerful feedback loops of growth or destruction, depending on how you direct and control your life. There is definitely a ton of tension, but it can be highly productive tension, if you master it and put it to work for you. The square is the most energetically intense aspect, even if it is adversarial, and can lead to good results just as well as it can lead to bad ones. Here comes in a second concept: overcoming. When planet A has a square with planet B, if B lies on the right side of A, then A overcomes B. If B lies on the left side of A, then A is overcome by B. This is loosely a balance of power issue - without your intervention, the stronger planet prevails and pushes your life in the direction that it chooses.
For you, the houses involved are 3, 6, 9 and 12. I am not sure which house I should begin my examination from, but in any case there's many different interpretations - you might want to look up all the significations of these three houses.
Cont

No such thing as empty houses - they each have signs and you can also consult the house ruler to see what other factors are going to interact with the house topics. At least that's how we do things in whole sign.
For example: you got Venus in the 6th house, but it also rules the 11th house of societies and friends. Consequently, we might suppose that you could join some kind of medical association and make plenty of friends there. Similarly, the sun importing 7th house topics of partnerships into the 2nd house of finance could mean that you become a businessman (two-party contracts) or a professional matchmaker. (Or a pimp? LOL.)
I guess a super quick rundown of your chart might be that romance is super important to you (Sun in 7th) and that you're after serious, mature girls (Sun in Capricorn). Ascendant ruler in 12th might mean grappling with enemies (possibly women since the moon is in the 12th) or mental illness. Gemini moon also means being good at languages. 9th house Saturn might mean problems with education, like becoming a dropout. Or religious problems. Mars in 3rd might mean problems with practical activity.

posts.com:
We gather in these generals to discuss our experiences, memories, and connection with Mother Lilith, as well as give other anons who are interested or would like to learn more about Her information or advice.

>Practices or rituals associated with Lilith?
This differs from person to person, but common approaches include giving energy to one of her sigils, chanting her enn, working with sexual spirits, doing what you think she would do, making offerings of incense/chocolate/tea, or simply praying.
While some people might feel the most comfortable engaging with her in a worshipful manner, blind faith is discouraged. It's always important to think and make decisions for oneself, and as such, Lilith guides us to understand things for ourselves.

>Books
- Liber Lilith by Donald Tyberson: https://www.pdfdrive.com/liber-lilith-a-gnostic-grimoire-e185231845.html
A Gnostic Grimoire and Novel. Beware that this book is rather dark, and some have mentioned attracting unwanted attention by reading it.
- Embracing Lilith by Mark H Williams: No PDF available online, but it's worth the price of admission.
Split into three sections, it covers accounts of working with the Goddess and her place in history, a fictional account of her origins written from her perspective, and a Grimoire.
- Lilith: Dark Feminine Archetype by Asenath Mason: https://pdfcoffee.com/lilith-dark-feminine-archetype-2-pdf-free.html
This one is a collection of writings by various peoples, with a brief but fairly thorough history at the beginning. There's a lot of random poetry in there; not useful for an occultist, but decent for an admirer.
- Lilith: Goddess of Sitra Ahra: https://zeitenundformen.files.wordpress.com/2014/01/lilith-goddess-of-sitra-ahrab-t-p.pdf
Contains a ton of aspects with associated variety of sigils.

>>33857133
Sure. Stress causes the body to tense. Sustained trauma and stress causes a perpetual state of tension in the body. Specific memories of traumatic events can cause the body to tense in certain areas. For example, being punched in the stomach repeatedly and unexpectedly can cause the abdominal muscles to remain tensed indefinitely in preparation for a surprise attack. This then creates a compounding effect where the pelvic floor and back become unbalanced. This imbalance then disrupts the flow of energy in the body. You can read "The Body Keeps the Score" if you are interested in the mechanisms behind this.

Most people who have difficulties in this area tend to have issues around the heart chakra/diaphragm. This is because breathing becomes shallow in anticipation of a threat. I've actually noticed by taking long walks where the tension spots are in my chest area. I recommend trying that if you want to find your tension areas. Unblocking the chest through conscious deep breathing will make dealing with everything else that will come up much easier, so I think dealing with that first is probably the best route.

As simple as it sounds, it is not easy. You have spent years breathing differently so it takes conscious effort to make full, deep breaths. In addition the muscle tightness is actually going to inhibit your ability to do so. So it will take a lot of effort and remembering to breathe properly. As we know, the breath is tied to the flow of the body. If you can correct this then other things will become easier to deal with.

Besides TRE, another good practice is vagus nerve stimulation. I recommend doing that at a time when you can take a nap afterwards though.

I want to avoid those extreme scenarios, though. The best way I've found to do that is by not making assumptions in haste and always "re-calibrating" by own measure for what is good and right. If what I think is good and right leads me to hurting someone who is not evil, then I have to make absolutely sure there was no other way.
So, if my brother was doing evil things because he thought they were good, and reasoning with him was not working, then I would have to put him down myself. i think I get what OP is driving at, I would contrast an animated feature like The Man Who Planted Trees from 1988 and Avatar, both have purportedly environmental messages, but one does with artful but somewhat crude hand-drawn images that suggest what they wish to emulate for the viewers and only focus on the essential, while the other uses a warehouse of computers and soulless calculations to imitate such trivial things as the fluid dynamics of water, which is utterly irrelevant to the core message of the movie (if there is one) when you think about it.
I think modern special effects hurt the audience's imagination, and yes I do think on some level it has an influence on its perception of reality. I can't put it more eloquently or elegantly but I d say it puts materialism above spirituality and imagination, and power and elitism above sincerity and communication.

>>33859123
look into vocoders
>The human voice consists of sounds generated by the opening and closing of the glottis by the vocal cords, which produces a periodic waveform with many harmonics. This basic sound is then filtered by the nose and throat (a complicated resonant piping system) to produce differences in harmonic content (formants) in a controlled way, creating the wide variety of sounds used in speech. There is another set of sounds, known as the unvoiced and plosive sounds, which are created or modified by the mouth in different fashions.

>The vocoder examines speech by measuring how its spectral characteristics change over time. This results in a series of signals representing these frequencies at any particular time as the user speaks. In simple terms, the signal is split into a number of frequency bands (the larger this number, the more accurate the analysis) and the level of signal present at each frequency band gives the instantaneous representation of the spectral energy content. To recreate speech, the vocoder simply reverses the process, processing a broadband noise source by passing it through a stage that filters the frequency content based on the originally recorded series of numbers.

>Specifically, in the encoder, the input is passed through a multiband filter, then the output of each band is measured using an envelope follower, and the signals from the envelope followers are transmitted to the decoder. The decoder applies these as control signals to corresponding amplifiers of the output filter channels.

posts.com:
>Can anyone project/shift/have an out of body experience?
Yes.

>Is it not just a vivid lucid dream?
No. A full successful astral projection/shift/oobe feels just as, and often even more real than the waking reality you're experiencing right now. The difference between this and even extremely vivid lucid dreams is absolutely huge.

>Does it have to be difficult and take me months/years to attain this ability?
No, it does not, the only barrier is your mind - both conscious and subconscious. If you think it's going to be difficult, it will. Many people can be successful within their first few tries.

>How come? And how is even this connected to astral travel?
There exists an infinite amount of realities with infinite "you's" into which you can focus your conscious awareness. Astral projection and other OOBEs are, in essence, the same thing - projecting your consciousness into the Astral Plane etc.

>Do I have to come back?
Not from shifting.
Yes from projecting, but also somewhat up for debate.

>Does this have anything to do with the teenager trend spreading on TikTok and in other places?
Yes and no. Kids latching onto an idea they may not even understand, pay them no attention.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33839173
>any advice on breaking through the stage im stuck on
Most powerful technique is to manipulate your subconscious mind through denial of desires. For example, make it a point that you'll eat no more food until you astral project, once you finally AP you can eat again. You could also do this with sexual gratification, internet, water, anything that has powerful urges connected to it, you deny that desire and tell yourself the only way to get what you want is to astral project. The point is creating as much stress as possible within the subconscious, resulting in powerful subconscious motivation to AP, which is especially important because it's highly probable that right now you're subconsciously resistant to AP.

What techniques you use in combination with this isn't super important, it's only important that you practice them as often as possible. What's most likely going to happen is you're going to fall asleep at some point during this process and your subconscious will do the work for you, you'll wake up right into the mind awake body asleep/vibratory stage and that's when the work you've put towards practicing separation will be most useful

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33820441
Body asleep, mind awake.

Lay down, almost like you're about to fall asleep. Get into to a comfortable position. Next, close your eyes and keep your mind awake while your body drifts asleep.

The key part about keeping your mind awake is this: it doesn't mean staying alert. Body asleep. Mind awake. Sit back, and relax. Don't think too hard, let thoughts come to you. You will be laying down on your bed, and the thoughts will come to you bubbling into your mind. Let them grow. Look at them, focus on them. Eventually, images, and sounds will form. Peer into those. Walk into it, as if you were walking with your body.

And there you have it!

>So how directly were you involved? Was it just through the funding or were you actually physically there in Hong Kong among the protestors?
I was there in Hong Kong throughout the entire event, but I had no direct or indirect interaction with anyone involved in the protests because I was under official cover at the US consulate in HK.

I did however design a large part of the training and indoctrination techniques that were taught and used on the protestors. My biggest contribution was a position I created called "Revolution Consultants" and "People Leaders" which were part of these pro-democracy organizations, and I designed a fake history for these non-profit orgs which involved them helping inspire and set up revolutions to change oppressive government policies worldwide. It was all made to sound really pretentious and appealing to the outspoken "activist" mindset that a lot of these young people had. They were mostly college students.

These so-called revolutionary consultants were at first officers who were under Non-official cover with identities that had no ties to the US government. We communicated with them indirectly and face-to-face briefings would take place outside HK and the mainland in places like Thailand or the Philippines. The officers would then recruit candidates (usually members of student orgs at universities or members of trade unions) to fill out new "consultant" positions, and these guys would find people under them to do the same. In design, it was pretty much very similar to a Multi-Level marketing shill, but designed for "revolutionary activities," It also helped further distance our people further and further from the actual protestors, and the presence of so-many "consultants" and "leaders" with equal ranking helped to decentralize the chain-of-command, which was to prevent everything from going to shit if a large number of them were arrested.

It went to shit anyways, but for a different reason.

You can express your last dreams, your attempts and ask anything about it

WBTB: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WBTB-Tutorial
MILD: http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-mild-guide/
additional MILD info:
http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-intention-setting/
SSILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/129734-senses-initiated-lucid-dream-ssild.html
WILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WILD-Tutorial
FILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/36683-finger-induced-lucid-dream-fild.html
DEILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/DEILD-Tutorial
CANWILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wake-initiated-lucid-dreams-wild/87710-%2A%2Acrazyinsanes-wild-tutorial-%2A%2A.html
CAT: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/CAT-Tutorial
ADA: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/113253-all-day-awareness-dild-tutorial-kingyoshi.html

Paper on natural LDs: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6290891/

Do us a favor and bump this general from time to time if you're interested

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

I often have what i would call dreams inbetween normal state and lucid. what i mean is that I'm in first person, kind of conscious, and my actions reflect what I would do/would like to do in that scenario. posts.com:
>>33806643
>How do i know if it's lucid dreaming or not?
You recognize a "full blown lucid dream" by your mental clarity, not what you're able to do. In full lucid dreams you have the same kind of sharp thinking as in real life, able to fully self-reflect and process thoughts as in waking life. In what you call dreams ibetween it's more like you're a zombie with a vague notion that there are no consequences for your actions.

>>33807184
If you're religious, you might benefit from thinking lucid dreaming is some kind of magic phenomena, since it will make it feel more real. If you want to just DILD, do the boring basic shit like keeping a dream journal, reality checks, and MILD before bed.

posts.com:
well gents, new year new goals. something i wish to take seriously this year is something i've come to call "wake-sleeping", although i suppose a more fitting name might simply be "lucid sleeping".

the concept is quite simple: remain aware whenever the body sleeps. it would certainly be similar to WILD, except it takes place at bed time, and ends when you would normally wake up; the ultimate goal being, to completely and entirely decouple consciousness from sleep. the most advanced form of this practice, theoretically, would result in one who never lapses in consciousness, 24/7 awareness.

i've made some progress on making this work, but it's obviously hard. it is certainly possible, however, and so i remain confident in its feasibility, but the trial and error is long and grueling.

i will keep updates in these threads as meaningful developments occur, as this intersects plainly with lucid dreaming (engaging in this practice successfully would have a side effect of making ALL dreams lucid).

Here, I give you an actual answer in western occult tradition. This is the kind of quality this board deserves, but rarely receives from its posters.

The sun relates to Tiphareth on the Tree of life.
Black is the color of Saturn, or "Binah".

YHVH Eloah ve-Da’ath
Hebrew for “Lord God of Knowledge,” this is the divine name of Tiphareth.
Tiphareth, the Sun, is also Jesus, unconditional love.

Whereas
YHVH
Referred to as the Tetragrammaton, this high name of God is unpronouncable. The letters Yod Heh Vav Heh are attributed to the elements of Fire, Water, Air, and Earth and to the worlds of Atziluth, Briah, Yetzirah, and Assiah respectively. As this word is replaced in biblical reading by the name Adonai, this name is also translated as “Lord.”

This is the God name of Saturn
Saturn is boundaries of our reality
The terrible mother who let's her child starve
Who kills by circumstance
The cold winter, not the blunt force
The elements
Saturn is the "Greater Malefic"

The Sun is depicted as the dot within the circle (boundary) of Saturn. It is supposed to overcome and it does overcome.
Love defeats machiavellianism, for a lover can neither be bought nor intimidated.

The black sun however, is Saturn overcoming the Sun. It represented the Void in Buddhism. It is no coincidene this symbol was displayed at Wewelsburg, HQ of Reichsführer SS Heinrich Himmler, who in one of his most famous speeches justified the killing of children as preventing
them from avenging their parents while explicitly consoling the officers blaming themselves for it, saying it was the right thing to do.
His speech received enthusiastic applause by the SS officers.
This was the meaning of the "Black Sun". It is a defeated Sun.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>33851718
>Eggs evolved first
By definition, an egg is the larger of the two types of gametes in a sexually reproducing species meaning eggs cannot exist without a sperm counterpart.
Also, isogamy (sex cells being the same size) is a thing and performs the same function as anisogamous sex cells.
The advantage of anisogamy is one gamete can invest in nutrient retention and resources (the egg) and the other can specialize in motility to get to the bigger sex cell with the pre-packaged nutrients (the sperm).

Modern playing cards are an adaptation of the Rider-Waite Tarot. The 4 suits and 52 overall cards (excluding the Joker) are exactly the same as the 4 suits and 56 cards of the Minor Arcana. The difference is, aside from the specific symbolism for each card's art in the Tarot and the utter minimalism of the modern playing cards. That, and also the Jacks of playing cards is a synthesis of the Pages and the Knights in Tarot.

As for the Joker, it's the Fool of the Major Arcana.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Bedlam_in_Goliath
>On a trip in Jerusalem, Rodriguez-Lopez purchased an archaic ouija-type talking board at a curio shop as a gift for Bixler-Zavala. They would return to their tour bus after shows to play with it during their 2006 tour with the Red Hot Chili Peppers, as it quickly became the band's post-show ritual. Dubbed "The Soothsayer", the board revealed stories, gave names and made demands, as the band was contacted by three different people who appeared in the form of one, who was then referred to as "Goliath". The more the band interacted with "The Soothsayer", otherworldly coincidences began plaguing the band's experience writing and recording The Bedlam in Goliath: Blake Fleming, their drummer at the time, quit mid-tour and left the band with financial troubles; Bixler-Zavala wound up needing surgery performed on his foot due to the shoes he had been wearing, forcing him to relearn how to walk post-surgery; audio tracks sporadically disappeared from the studio's harddrives; Rodriguez-Lopez's home studio flooded and was subject to multiple power outages; and the album's original engineer went through a nervous breakdown, leaving behind all previous work with no notes as to where anything was. The engineer who quit stated to Rodriguez-Lopez: "I'm not going to help you make this record. You're trying to do something very bad with this record, you're trying to make me crazy and you're trying to make people crazy."

Rodriguez-Lopez was on the brink of starting the recording from scratch. Midway through the recording sessions, Rodriguez-Lopez broke "The Soothsayer" in half and buried it in an undisclosed location as an attempt to undo the curse and halt the unforeseen tragedies. Rodriguez-Lopez swore never to give away the location of the burial, and also asked the band not to speak of it again during the remainder of the album's production.

NTA, but any worthwhile truth can be uncovered without DMT. I'm not saying nothing can be learned from ayahuasca, but I would never tease anyone that an otherwise hidden away capital T Truth can be accessed by just drinking ayahuasca. All forms of intoxication bring a change of consciousness and perspective, it can be both good or bad, revelatory or trivial depending on many factors. I wouldn't recommend or discourage anyone from taking ayahuasca, but I would warn there is a price to pay and no real tangible benefits that can not be gained otherwise.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Most of the value of taking large doses of psychedelics comes from a shift in perception of your life. The shift in perception sticks with you, and having that new perspective may help you with things.

Bad trips are real, which is why shamans have been passing down the tradition for centuries with various methods for driving the experience. The singing, drumming, and dancing shamans may do are meant to shape your experience, and to some degree they do. There's a lower chance of having a bad trip with a good shaman, but not if you're anxious about it in the first place.


If you can really find somewhere reputable, and you're not ridiculously anxious about what might happen, go for it.

>Useful tips before posting:
•If you're a reader post that you're offering readings and what information is required from the querent; same goes for trading.
•Look for posts to determine if there's an active reader, what's needed and before posting, check if they finished reading already.
•Some readers will refuse to do certain readings - respect that choice. Do not harass readers if your query is refused/skipped.
•Traders should respect that a traded read will be granted, as per an agreement of trade. Free readers have the option of picking their queries.
•Bullshit queries will get bullshit answers. Same for vague queries.
•Making an AQ (air query) by not addressing a reader, in particular, is possible but doesn't guarantee an answer.
•Avoid making the same query repeatedly and/or to different readers in a short period of time, as this may lead to more confusion.
•Provide feedback when applicable and be considerate to the reader. We're a growing community, many readers are starting and need to know what they are doing right or wrong. Let's help each other to improve.

I still sit sometimes and wonder my purpose, this desire is my only anchor left in this world, tied by a small string of questions too stubborn to let go of the whole chain and anchor , still seeking for the one bearing my most desired answers.
I thought once going on hunt for angels might finally be my way to find my answers, if such being bathing in divine light could share from it's wisdom with me, to answer me these questions that skin me on the inside and burn me like fire. But you can't find angels outside of the life of a monk unless you really follow the teachings for a man of the world and faith properly.
>Would this, in a way, make us a demiurge, unaware of our role as a god towards our creations nor being able to understand their suffering as they are but mental constructs?
I really don't know about this but i wonder if my egoistic desire is an act of crime in the greater plane, from my small isolated hut i just see the desire i set in me since childhood, to do this thing but don't know if it has any other implications.
This thread sparked back my inner conflict.
